core.adaptation

Class AbstractAdaptation<S,T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.transformation.AbstractTransformation<S,T>
      • core.adaptation.AbstractAdaptation<S,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - The type of the source element to adapt.
    T - The type of the target element to obtain.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAdaptation<S,T>, ITransformation<S,T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractNaryAssociationAdaptation, AbstractRelationshipWithAbstractMembersAdaptation, AggregationToAssociationAdaptation, BidirectionalAssociationToUnidirectionalAssociationsAdaptation, CompositionToAssociationAdaptation, DependencyToAssociationAdaptation, SimpleGeneralizationAdaptation

    public abstract class AbstractAdaptation<S,T>
extends AbstractTransformation<S,T>
implements IAdaptation<S,T>
    an AbstractAdaptation abstract class that is used to factor the common interface and state of all concrete atomic metamodeling adaptation classes.

    It must be specialized by all concrete metamodeling adaptation classes.
    Author:
    Bachar Rima
    See Also:
    AbstractTransformation, IAdaptation

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class core.transformation.AbstractTransformation

        source, target

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractAdaptation()
      Creates an empty adaptation
      AbstractAdaptation(S source)
      Creates an adaptation from a source element and applies the adaptation afterwards to directly get the target.
